name: Pec Deck Machine
description: Sit with back against pad, arms on pads at chest height. Bring arms together in front of chest, squeezing pecs. Return to starting position with control. Excellent for chest isolation.

name: Landmine Press
description: Hold end of landmine barbell at chest level. Press forward and up at an angle. Great for upper chest and shoulder engagement with reduced shoulder stress.

name: Svend Press
description: Hold weight plates together at chest level. Press plates forward while squeezing them together. Return to chest. Excellent for inner chest activation.

name: Close Grip Bench Press
description: Lie on bench with hands closer than shoulder-width. Lower bar to chest, keeping elbows tucked. Press back up. Targets inner chest and triceps.

name: Single Arm Dumbbell Press
description: Lie on bench holding one dumbbell. Press up while stabilizing core. Unilateral training improves balance and addresses strength imbalances.

name: Deficit Push-Ups
description: Place hands on elevated surfaces. Lower chest below hand level for increased range of motion. Push back up. Increases chest stretch and activation.

name: Pendlay Rows
description: Barbell starts on ground each rep. Pull explosively to lower chest, then return to ground. Builds explosive pulling power and back thickness.

name: Chest Supported Rows
description: Lie face down on incline bench. Row dumbbells to sides, squeezing shoulder blades. Removes lower back stress and isolates upper back.

name: Inverted Rows
description: Lie under bar set at waist height. Pull chest to bar, keeping body straight. Lower with control. Bodyweight alternative to barbell rows.

name: Single Arm Dumbbell Rows
description: Place one knee and hand on bench. Row dumbbell to hip with other arm. Squeeze shoulder blade at top. Excellent for unilateral back development.

name: Meadows Rows
description: Stand perpendicular to landmine. Row bar to hip with one arm. Unique angle targets lats and upper back differently than traditional rows.

name: Straight Arm Pulldowns
description: Stand at cable machine with bar overhead. Pull down to thighs with straight arms. Isolates lats and teaches proper lat engagement.

name: Rack Pulls
description: Set barbell on rack pins at knee height. Deadlift from this position. Allows heavier loads and focuses on upper back and traps.

name: Hack Squats
description: Stand on hack squat platform with shoulders under pads. Lower by bending knees, then drive back up. Excellent quad isolation with reduced back stress.

name: Walking Lunges
description: Lunge forward continuously, alternating legs. Builds functional leg strength and balance. Can be done with or without weights.

name: Leg Extensions
description: Sit in leg extension machine. Extend legs until straight, squeezing quads at top. Lower with control. Pure quad isolation exercise.

name: Step-Ups
description: Step onto elevated surface with one leg, drive through heel to stand. Step down and repeat. Functional unilateral leg exercise.

name: Glute Ham Raises
description: Secure feet in GHD machine. Lower torso towards ground, then pull back up using hamstrings. Elite hamstring and glute developer.

name: Seated Leg Curls
description: Sit in machine with ankles under pad. Curl legs down, squeezing hamstrings. Return with control. Isolates hamstrings effectively.

name: Pistol Squats
description: Stand on one leg, extend other leg forward. Squat down on standing leg. Advanced single-leg strength and balance exercise.

name: Donkey Calf Raises
description: Bend at hips with pad on lower back. Raise heels as high as possible. Unique angle for maximum calf stretch and contraction.

name: Cable Lateral Raises
description: Stand sideways to cable machine. Raise arm out to side against cable resistance. Constant tension on side delts throughout movement.

name: Front Raises
description: Hold dumbbells at thighs. Raise arms forward to shoulder height. Lower with control. Isolates front deltoids.

name: Bradford Press
description: Press barbell from front to back of head in continuous motion. Keeps shoulders under constant tension. Use lighter weight.

name: Bus Drivers
description: Hold weight plate at arms length. Rotate plate like steering wheel. Burns shoulders and improves endurance.

name: Seated Rear Delt Flyes
description: Sit bent forward. Raise dumbbells out to sides, squeezing rear delts. Isolates often-neglected rear deltoids.

name: Cable Face Pulls High
description: Set cable high. Pull rope towards forehead, separating hands. Targets rear delts and upper traps. Excellent for posture.

name: EZ Bar Curls
description: Hold EZ bar with underhand grip. Curl up, squeezing biceps. EZ bar reduces wrist strain compared to straight bar.

name: Cable Bicep Curls
description: Stand at cable machine with bar attachment. Curl up, maintaining constant tension. Cable provides consistent resistance throughout.

name: Spider Curls
description: Lie face down on incline bench. Curl bar up with arms hanging. Eliminates momentum and isolates biceps peak.

name: Drag Curls
description: Curl barbell up while dragging it along torso, elbows moving back. Unique angle for bicep stimulation.

name: Reverse Curls
description: Hold barbell with overhand grip. Curl up, keeping wrists straight. Targets brachialis and forearms.

name: Close Grip Push-Ups
description: Push-up with hands close together forming diamond shape. Emphasizes triceps over chest.

name: Rope Overhead Extensions
description: Face away from cable with rope overhead. Extend arms forward. Constant tension on triceps throughout movement.

name: Bench Dips
description: Place hands on bench behind you, legs extended. Lower body by bending elbows, then push back up. Bodyweight tricep exercise.

name: Tate Press
description: Lie on bench with dumbbells. Lower weights to sides of chest with elbows out. Unique tricep isolation movement.

name: Ab Wheel Rollouts
description: Kneel with ab wheel. Roll forward extending body, then pull back. Elite core strengthener requiring full-body tension.

name: Dead Bug
description: Lie on back with arms and legs up. Lower opposite arm and leg simultaneously. Teaches core stability and coordination.

name: Pallof Press
description: Stand sideways to cable. Press handle forward, resisting rotation. Anti-rotation exercise for core stability.

name: V-Ups
description: Lie flat. Simultaneously raise legs and torso, reaching for toes. Lower with control. Intense full ab workout.

name: Side Plank
description: Lie on side, prop up on elbow. Raise hips creating straight line. Hold position. Targets obliques and lateral core stability.

name: Windshield Wipers
description: Hang from bar with legs raised. Rotate legs side to side. Advanced oblique and lower ab exercise.

name: Hollow Body Hold
description: Lie on back, raise shoulders and legs slightly. Hold hollow position with lower back pressed down. Gymnastic core fundamental.

name: Dragon Flags
description: Lie on bench, grip behind head. Raise entire body keeping it straight, lower with control. Elite-level core exercise.

name: Landmine Rotations
description: Hold end of landmine at chest. Rotate side to side in controlled motion. Builds rotational power and oblique strength.

name: Decline Sit-Ups
description: Secure feet on decline bench. Perform sit-ups against gravity. Increased difficulty compared to flat surface.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes
description: Lie on incline bench. Lower dumbbells out to sides in arc motion. Bring back together above chest. Stretches and isolates upper chest.

name: Neutral Grip Pull-Ups
description: Use parallel grip handles. Pull up until chin clears bar. Neutral grip reduces shoulder stress and emphasizes biceps.

name: Zercher Squats
description: Hold barbell in crook of elbows. Squat down keeping torso upright. Unique loading pattern challenges core and legs differently.

name: Lu Raises
description: Hold plate at waist. Raise overhead in arc motion. Lower behind head, then reverse. Full shoulder range of motion exercise.

name: Wrist Curls
description: Rest forearms on bench with wrists hanging off. Curl wrists up and down. Builds forearm and grip strength.
